org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.impl.generator

Class BagItPackageAssembler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.impl.generator.BagItPackageAssembler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.generator.PackageAssembler

    public class BagItPackageAssembler
extends Object
implements org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.generator.PackageAssembler

    Assembles a BagIt package. Bags assembled by this particular implementation will conform to BagIt specification version V0.97

    This implementation uses org.apache.commons.compress library to perform archiving and compression operations on the resulting package. Thereore, it is limited to only support the archiving and compression formats specified in org.apache.commons.compress.archivers.ArchiveStreamFactory and org.apache.commons.compress.compressors.CompressorStreamFactory. If the archiving format is "exploded," the assembler will stage the package in the location normally specified for the package file, and the assemblePackage() method will return a null package without deleting the staged content

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.model.PackageGenerationParameters params,
                 Map<String,List<String>> packageMetadata)
        Initializes the Assembler. Operations include:
        • Checking for required parameters
        • Creating a base directory for the bag
        • Creating a payload directory

        Required parameters for this kind of Assembler include:

        • package-name
        • Bag-It-Profile-Identifier

        Optional with defaults parameters:

        • archiving-format: when not set, is defaulted to ".tar"
        • compression-format: when not set, no compression will be performed on the serialized content.
        • checksum-algs: when not set, is defaulted to "md5"

        NOTE: If this is called a second time, the first initialization will still take effect unless parameters are specifically overridden in the second call. It's probably not a good idea to call this more than once in most cases; if you just need to add parameters after initialization, use the addParameter method.

        Specified by:
        init in interface org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.generator.PackageAssembler
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters object containing whatever is needed for the assembler.
        packageMetadata - contains BagIt metadata used to populate the bag-info.txt

      • assemblePackage

        public org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.Package assemblePackage()
        The process of assembling a BagIt bag includes these following steps:
        • Create bagit.txt file
        • Create bag-info.text file
        • Calculate checksums for each file in bag
        • Write manifest files
        • Write tag-manifest files
        Specified by:
        assemblePackage in interface org.dataconservancy.packaging.tool.api.generator.PackageAssembler
        Returns:
        A Package object which encapsulate the following elements regarding the package:
        • serialize InputStream to the content of the produced package.
        • packageName String value which is the suggested file name for the package file
        • contentType String value which indicate the content type of the package content

        public void validateParams()
